title: 24 Rums
description: Two people explore the 24 Days of Rum advent calendar as a way to plan future vacations

items.title: Guyana - Pusser's Rum Gunpowder Proof 54.5%

items.content_html:
Pusserâ€™s Rum Gunpowder Proof is the highest proof rum in the 24 Days of Rum box.

The story of Gunpowder Proof Rum began in the days of â€˜wooden ships and iron men,â€™ when Royal Navy sailors were issued a daily â€˜totâ€™ of rum on board ship, rationed out by the shipâ€™s â€˜Purserâ€™ (known as â€˜Pusserâ€™ to the sailors). To shut down claims of watered-down rum, the Pusser would douse a few grains of gunpowder in the rum and attempt to light it. If the mix ignited, the rum was â€˜at proof.â€™ If not, the pusser might find himself tossed to sea. This beloved tradition continued for over 300 years until the Admiralty ended the daily rum ration on 31 July 1970â€“now known as Black Tot Day.

After distillation, the rum is aged for a minimum of three years in charred oak bourbon barrelsâ€”imparting additional smoothness and flavor. The tropical climate in Guyana helps the rum reach its maturity faster than spirits aged in higher latitudes. Pusserâ€™s Rum is all natural â€“ no artificial flavouring or colouring is added.

About Pusserâ€™s Rum

Pusserâ€™s Rum rums are blended to create the ideal balance of naturally occurring flavouring compounds known as â€œestersâ€ and â€œcongeners.â€ The molasses used in each of the contributing stills comes from sugar cane grown in the Demerara River Valleyâ€”once the home of 300 sugar cane estates each with its own distillery. This geographic region has been renowned for its production and worldwide distribution of sugar since the 1600s. It is often referred to as the â€œValley of Navy Rum.â€

Tasting notes

The Author: Volatile, brown sugar booze, spicy, vanilla bean syrup

Rum partner: Harsh/honey, burnt brown sugar, toffee on the finish

Rum rating

Taste 4 stars 2 stars 3 stars
Overall 3 stars 2 stars 2.5 stars

Additional rum resources

About Guyana

Guyana, a country on South Americaâ€™s North Atlantic coast, is defined by its dense rainforest. English-speaking, with cricket and calypso music, itâ€™s culturally connected to the Caribbean region. Its capital, Georgetown, is known for British colonial architecture, including tall, painted-timber St. Georgeâ€™s Anglican Cathedral. A large clock marks the facade of Stabroek Market, a source of local produce.

Should we visit Guyana?

Pros

  • Large Indian population
  • 80% virgin rainforest
  • Waterfall that is five times the height of Niagara Falls

Cons

  • Jonestown?

Fun fact about Guyana

In a country of less than 1 million people where English is the official language, there are also 10 recognized languages in Guyana.

Travel rating

Want to visit 2 stars 2 stars 2 stars

items.title: Peru - Ron Millonario 10 Anniversario Reserva 40%
items.summary: Ron Millonario 10 Anniversario Reserva is from Peru and it is like sweet orange candy
items.content_text: Ron Millonario 10 Anniversario Reserva is a rum from Peru. There isnâ€™t any production information on their official website. But there is this description:  Warm amber in colour, it has an easy and never aggressive nose. Candied oranges, bergamot tea, vanilla and a hint of cola nut are its main aromas. At the palate, itâ€™s lighter and fresher than the older expressions: mainly it tastes of chestnut and acacia honey, candied oranges and citrons and sultana raisins. Slightly hidden, but still evident, are nuts, chocolate, desiccated plums and apricots. Only at the end a peppery sting from the alcohol becomes just noticeable.About Ron MillonarioIn 1904, in northern Peru, the Hacienda AgrÃ­cola de Chiclayo was founded in Chiclayo, a small settlement between the sea and the mountains known as the â€˜city of friendship.â€™ 1950 was an unforgettable year: Ron Millonario was born officially.The rum was the result of hard work, but since few could afford to sample it, it acquired the name â€œpor los millonariosâ€, in acknowledgement of that exclusive club of individuals wealthy enough to buy the spirit and enjoy its unique charm.Tasting notesThe Author: Orange candy, mint, cotton candyRum partner: Tea/eucalyptus, cola, spiced, taste is better than the smellRum rating            Â       The Author      Rum partner      Average                  Smell      4 stars      3 stars      3.5 stars              Taste      3 stars      4 stars      3.5 stars              Overall      3 stars      4 stars      3.5 stars      Additional rum resources  Day 2 on 24 Days of Rum  Ron Millonario - official websiteAbout PeruPeru is a country in South America thatâ€™s home to a section of Amazon rainforest and Machu Picchu, an ancient Incan city high in the Andes mountains. The region around Machu Picchu, including the Sacred Valley, Inca Trail and colonial city of Cusco, is rich in archaeological sites. On Peruâ€™s arid Pacific coast is Lima, the capital, with a preserved colonial center and important collections of pre-Columbian art.Should we visit Peru?Pros  Machu Picchu  Rainbow Mountain  City of Lima  Good Pisco Sours & CevicheCons  ?Fun fact about PeruThere are over 3,000 different varieties of Potato grown in Peru.Travel rating            Â       The Author      Travel partner      Average                  Want to visit      3 stars      n/a      Â               Want to visit again      n/a      3.5 stars      Â               Overall      Â       Â       3.25 stars      Additional travel resources  Peru on Wikipedia  Peru on Lonely Planet
items.content_html:
Ron Millonario 10 Anniversario Reserva is a rum from Peru. There isnâ€™t any production information on their official website. But there is this description:

Warm amber in colour, it has an easy and never aggressive nose. Candied oranges, bergamot tea, vanilla and a hint of cola nut are its main aromas. At the palate, itâ€™s lighter and fresher than the older expressions: mainly it tastes of chestnut and acacia honey, candied oranges and citrons and sultana raisins. Slightly hidden, but still evident, are nuts, chocolate, desiccated plums and apricots. Only at the end a peppery sting from the alcohol becomes just noticeable.

About Ron Millonario

In 1904, in northern Peru, the Hacienda AgrÃ­cola de Chiclayo was founded in Chiclayo, a small settlement between the sea and the mountains known as the â€˜city of friendship.â€™ 1950 was an unforgettable year: Ron Millonario was born officially.The rum was the result of hard work, but since few could afford to sample it, it acquired the name â€œpor los millonariosâ€, in acknowledgement of that exclusive club of individuals wealthy enough to buy the spirit and enjoy its unique charm.

Tasting notes

The Author: Orange candy, mint, cotton candy

Rum partner: Tea/eucalyptus, cola, spiced, taste is better than the smell

About Peru

Peru is a country in South America thatâ€™s home to a section of Amazon rainforest and Machu Picchu, an ancient Incan city high in the Andes mountains. The region around Machu Picchu, including the Sacred Valley, Inca Trail and colonial city of Cusco, is rich in archaeological sites. On Peruâ€™s arid Pacific coast is Lima, the capital, with a preserved colonial center and important collections of pre-Columbian art.

Should we visit Peru?

Pros

  • Machu Picchu
  • Rainbow Mountain
  • City of Lima
  • Good Pisco Sours & Ceviche

Cons

  • ?

Fun fact about Peru

There are over 3,000 different varieties of Potato grown in Peru.

items.title: Barbados - Mount Gay XO Reserve 43%
items.summary: The very first rum in the 24 Days of Rum advent calendar
items.content_text: Mount Gay XO Reserve is a blend of rums aged 8-15 years distilled in a traditional column still and double retort pot still. The sugar cane used in this rum is fully sourced in Barbados and the Caribbean. A proprietary strain of heirloom yeast is used in closed fermentation for the column-distilled rum. For the pot-distilled rum, open-air fermentation is initially used. This process exposes the molasses and water to the Bajan atmosphere, allowing breezes to carry native yeasts into the mix. The rums were aged in three different cask types: ex-American Whiskey, Bourbon, and Cognac.About Mount GayA legal deed dated from February 20, 1703 confirms the existence of a â€œpot still houseâ€ on Mount Gayâ€™s sugar cane Estate in Barbados, which establishes Mount Gay as the worldâ€™s oldest rum producer. The name Mount Gay honours the pioneering Sir John Gay who perfected the distinctive Mount Gay style.Tasting notesThe Author: Cigar, caramel, wood, smoke, bourbon, molassesRum partner: Sweet, molasses, rock candy, good aftertasteRum rating            Â       The Author      Rum partner      Average                  Smell      3 stars      3 stars      3 stars              Taste      3 stars      5 stars      4 stars              Overall      3 stars      4 stars      3.5 stars      Additional rum resources  Day 1 on 24 Days of Rum  Mount Gay Rum - official websiteAbout BarbadosBarbados is an eastern Caribbean island and an independent British Commonwealth nation. Bridgetown, the capital, is a cruise-ship port with colonial buildings and Nidhe Israel, a synagogue founded in 1654. Around the island are beaches, botanical gardens, the Harrisonâ€™s Cave formation, and 17th-century plantation houses like St. Nicholas Abbey. Local traditions include afternoon tea and cricket, the national sport.Should we visit Barbados?Pros  Scuba diving  Historic downtown district (UNESCO World Heritage Centre)  Food toursCons  Lots of American touristsFun fact about BarbadosSome of the many other names for rum are Nelsonâ€™s blood, kill-devil, demon water, pirateâ€™s drink, navy neaters, and Barbados water.Also, Rhianna is from Barbados ğŸ˜‰Traveling rating            Â       The Author      Travel partner      Average                  Want to visit      4 stars      4.5 stars      4.25 stars      Additional travel resources  Barbados on Wikipedia  Barbados on Lonely Planet
items.content_html:
Mount Gay XO Reserve is a blend of rums aged 8-15 years distilled in a traditional column still and double retort pot still. The sugar cane used in this rum is fully sourced in Barbados and the Caribbean. A proprietary strain of heirloom yeast is used in closed fermentation for the column-distilled rum. For the pot-distilled rum, open-air fermentation is initially used. This process exposes the molasses and water to the Bajan atmosphere, allowing breezes to carry native yeasts into the mix. The rums were aged in three different cask types: ex-American Whiskey, Bourbon, and Cognac.

About Mount Gay

A legal deed dated from February 20, 1703 confirms the existence of a â€œpot still houseâ€ on Mount Gayâ€™s sugar cane Estate in Barbados, which establishes Mount Gay as the worldâ€™s oldest rum producer. The name Mount Gay honours the pioneering Sir John Gay who perfected the distinctive Mount Gay style.

Tasting notes

The Author: Cigar, caramel, wood, smoke, bourbon, molasses

Rum partner: Sweet, molasses, rock candy, good aftertaste

Rum rating

Â  The Author Rum partner Average
Smell 3 stars 3 stars 3 stars
Taste 3 stars 5 stars 4 stars
Overall 3 stars 4 stars 3.5 stars

Additional rum resources

  • Day 1 on 24 Days of Rum
  • Mount Gay Rum - official website


About Barbados

Barbados is an eastern Caribbean island and an independent British Commonwealth nation. Bridgetown, the capital, is a cruise-ship port with colonial buildings and Nidhe Israel, a synagogue founded in 1654. Around the island are beaches, botanical gardens, the Harrisonâ€™s Cave formation, and 17th-century plantation houses like St. Nicholas Abbey. Local traditions include afternoon tea and cricket, the national sport.

Should we visit Barbados?

Pros

  • Scuba diving
  • Historic downtown district (UNESCO World Heritage Centre)
  • Food tours

Cons

  • Lots of American tourists

Fun fact about Barbados

Some of the many other names for rum are Nelsonâ€™s blood, kill-devil, demon water, pirateâ€™s drink, navy neaters, and Barbados water.

Also, Rhianna is from Barbados ğŸ˜‰
